intro: Amauropelta pilosula, commonly known as the hairy shield fern, is a species of fern belonging to the family Blechnaceae. It is characterized by its distinctive, shield-shaped fronds that are often covered in fine, silky hairs. Native to the tropical regions of South America, this plant thrives in humid, shaded environments. The fronds are typically evergreen and can reach lengths of up to 30 centimeters. It is valued in horticulture for its ornamental appearance and ability to thrive in indoor conditions.
